perturbation.original_text: 5. VIEWING PERIOD.   The viewing period for each Licensed Program shall be at least twenty-four (24) consecutive hours, or such longer period as may be agreed to by Rogers and Licensor from time to time (the "Viewing Period"). Multiple viewings of the Licensed Program shall be permitted during the Viewing Period for no additional fee and all such viewings shall be considered a single exhibition of the Licensed Program for the purposes of calculating License Fees hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. VIEWING PERIOD.   The viewing period for each Licensed Program shall be determined by Rogers at its sole discretion (the "Viewing Period").
perturbation.explanation: By removing the guaranteed minimum viewing period of 24 hours, the contract now allows Rogers to set viewing periods shorter than what consumer protection laws in Canada may deem reasonable. This weakens consumer rights regarding access to rented content, violating potential provincial laws around fair business practices and consumer protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates Canadian provincial consumer protection laws regarding fair business practices and reasonable access to rented content. Specific laws would vary by province (e.g., Ontario's Consumer Protection Act).

perturbation.original_text: 27. APPLICABLE LAW.   This Agreement is subject to all laws, regulations, license conditions and decisions of the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission ("CRTC") municipal, provincial and federal governments or other authorities which are applicable to Rogers and/or Licensor, and which are now in force or hereafter adopted ("Applicable Law"). In the event that any such law, regulation or decision comes into force during the Term concerning the subject matter of this Agreement, such that it prevents or diminishes either party's ability to perform under this Agreement, the parties agree to enter into good faith negotiations to amend this Agreement, where required, in order to remedy such diminution of or inability to perform.
